description: The CIA confirmed the death of Michael Gloss, the son of Juliane Gallina, after a Russian news site reported that he had signed up to serve with Russian forces.
title: CIA official's son killed while fighting in Ukraine, spy agency says

description: When a lifesaving drug — insulin — is used as a murder weapon, medical professionals are likely unprepared to consider that the difficult-to-detect medication was used to commit a crime, according to a forensic pathologist who worked on the recent case of a West Virginia pharmacist convicted of fatally dosing her husband.
title: With insulin killings, the murder weapon is often hiding in plain sight

description: Steelers first-round draft pick Derrick Harmon’s mother died late Thursday night shortly after Pittsburgh selected the defensive lineman.
title: Steelers first-round pick Derrick Harmon’s mother dies shortly after his selection

description: Universities are continuing to warn international students about traveling abroad this summer as the Trump administration said Friday it would restore legal status to those who had had their visas revoked.
title: U.S. colleges warn international students not to travel overseas this summer

description: Hannah Dugan, a Milwaukee County judge arrested by the FBI for obstructing federal authorities in an immigration case, was a longtime social justice advocate.
title: Who is Hannah Dugan, the Milwaukee judge arrested by the FBI?

description: President Donald Trump harshly criticized NFL franchises for not drafting Colorado quarterback Shedeur Sanders in the first round of Thursday’s draft, calling all 32 team owners “stupid.”
title: Trump calls NFL owners 'stupid' for not taking Shedeur Sanders in first round

description: Multiple scientific publications have received letters from the Trump administration questioning their editorial practices and standards.
title: Medical journals complain of 'harassment' from Justice Department

description: The state of the two political parties is weak, according to a new batch of results from the NBC News Stay Tuned Poll — but for slightly different reasons.
title: Digging into Americans' sour views on both political parties: From the Politics Desk

description: The S&P 500 rose on Friday, adding to its strong gains for the week, as investors continue to navigate an evolving global trade landscape, while major tech names got a boost.
title: S&P 500 closes higher for a fourth day in a row, notches 4% gain for the week

description: Airshow pilot Rob Holland, 50, died in a plane crash Thursday at Langley Air Force Base in Virginia, according to authorities and his social media accounts.
title: Famed stunt pilot Rob Holland dies in plane crash days before airshow

description: A Texas mother who officials say took alcoholic Jell-O shots to her child’s elementary school Christmas party has been arrested.
title: Texas mother arrested after bringing Jell-O shots to 5th-grade classroom party

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has been focusing more on public and television appearances so he can speak directly to President Trump through the appearances.
title: Hegseth trying to show Trump he’s a fighter amid chaos in Pentagon

description: Jurors at Sean “Diddy” Combs’ sex trafficking trial will see video showing him assaulting his former girlfriend, a federal judge ruled Friday.
title: Video of Sean 'Diddy' Combs beating ex-girlfriend will be allowed at trial, judge rules

description: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell believes owners will come to a consensus in May on whether rule changes will be needed to eliminate the tush push play that’s helped the Philadelphia Eagles win one Super Bowl and reach another.
title: NFL commissioner believes owners will reach a decision soon on the tush push

description: Watch live coverage of the funeral for Pope Francis held in St. Peter’s Square in Vatican City. Religious officials, world leaders, and thousands of faithful from around the world will attend the service.
title: The funeral of Pope Francis

description: Alijah Arenas, a top high school basketball prospect, emerged from a coma and has shown "significant signs of progress," his family said Friday.
title: Top basketball recruit, son of former NBA star Gilbert Arenas out of coma following car accident

description: During Antarctica’s warm season, the sleek Norwegian passenger ship known as the MS Fridtjof Nansen departs regularly from Argentina for its journey south across the turbulent Drake Passage, down to the Antarctic Peninsula.
title: Research cuts leave Antarctic scientists turning to another source of funding: Tourist cruises

description: Wealthy philanthropists are grappling with a new landscape for giving, as government cuts create more funding needs but political battles make donations more fraught, according to several advisors.
title: As Trump targets Harvard and nonprofits, wealthy donors are wary of stepping up their giving

description: “Hey, how are you?” “Hey, how’s your sore back?” “Sorry, I’m running a little late; I’ll meet you for dinner at 6:15.”
title: Receiving odd texts for someone else? Rise of 'wrong number' messages is new payday for scammers.

description: President Donald Trump denied that a strong bond market sell-off influenced his decision earlier this month to hold off on aggressive “reciprocal” tariffs against U.S. trading partners.
title: Trump insists bond market tumult didn't influence tariff pause: 'I wasn't worried'

description: At car dealerships across the country, consumers are rushing to buy new vehicles ahead of tariff-related price hikes.
title: Buy now, stock up or delay: Here's what consumers are snapping up or putting off in face of tariffs

description: Many student loan borrowers recently got some unwelcome news: The U.S.
title: What payments can be garnished for defaulted student loans? Collections questions answered

description: Scott Peterson said in a declaration seeking to overturn his murder conviction that he had "absolutely nothing to do with the disappearance and deaths of my wife and son."
title: Scott Peterson says he had nothing to do with wife's death in push to overturn conviction

description: Quarterbacks are usually the biggest prize of the NFL draft's first round. Only two went last night.
title: Why are quarterbacks going undrafted this year?

description: NEW YORK — Luigi Mangione pleaded not guilty to federal stalking and murder charges on Friday in connection with the Dec. 4 murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.
title: Luigi Mangione pleads not guilty to federal murder and stalking charges

description: The DOJ said in federal court on Friday that it's abruptly changing course.
title: Students' legal statuses restored while ICE develops 'framework' for terminations

description: The world's greatest soccer stars have posted tributes to the Argentine pontiff, and the biggest homage is that his home team San Lorenzo's new stadium will be named after him.
title: Pope Francis adored fútbol, and the soccer world returns the love

description: Refugees commemorate the 50th anniversary of the fall of Saigon.
title: Vietnamese American families talk about leaving Saigon under the cover of night

description: Former Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson was arrested on a misdemeanor drunken driving charge Friday morning, according to jail records.
title: Former Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson arrested on DWI charge

description: Slate Auto, a firm backed in part by Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, is unveiling a low-cost electric truck that can also change into an SUV.
title: Bezos-backed Slate Auto unveils affordable EV truck

description: Luke Evans has carved out a niche for himself playing rugged, tough guys in "The Hobbit" and "Fast & Furious." But in his memoir, "Boy From the Valleys," the out gay Welsh actor showcases a more sensitive side.
title: In ‘Boy From the Valleys,’ Luke Evans chronicles his unlikely path to Hollywood

description: A federal judge in New York sentenced former Rep. George Santos to over seven years in prison Friday.
title: Former Rep. George Santos sentenced to more than 7 years in prison

description: The FBI has arrested Wisconsin Judge Hannah Dugan for allegedly interfering with an immigration operation. NBC News' Tom Winter has details on the arrest and how FBI Director Kash Patel broke the news in a since-deleted post on social media.
title: FBI arrests Wisconsin judge for allegedly interfering in immigration operation

description: Both political parties have significant work to do to convince Americans that they are fighting for them, according to the new NBC News Stay Tuned Poll powered by SurveyMonkey, with Democrats struggling to rally their own base of supporters.
title: Poll: A sizeable chunk of Americans think neither party 'fights for people like you'

description: President Donald Trump said in a new interview that he was joking when he promised to end the Russia-Ukraine war in the first 24 hours of his second term.
title: Trump calls his promise to end the Russia-Ukraine war on Day One 'an exaggeration'

description: One of the biggest potential hurdles to Casey DeSantis running for Florida governor in 2026 may have just been knocked down — for now.
title: How a controversy over Medicaid funds and marijuana complicates Casey DeSantis’ potential run for governor

description: Actor Jon Voight and his manager, Steven Paul, intend to present President Donald Trump with a suite of ideas to ramp up American film and television production.
title: Jon Voight plans to present Trump with ideas for boosting Hollywood production

description: A disgruntled former Disney employee was sentenced to three years in prison for altering menus that could've tricked customers into believing they were safe from certain allergies.
title: Former Disney worker sentenced for hacking into park menus, changing allergen information

description: Mahmoud Khalil, a pro-Palestinian activist and Columbia University graduate student who faces deportation, was detained without an arrest warrant last month, according to court documents released Thursday.
title: Columbia student Mahmoud Khalil was detained without an arrest warrant, Trump administration says

description: A Black man who was Tasered and left hospitalized after an arrest earlier this month has died, and his family is demanding justice and accountability.
title: Alabama man dies days after he was Tasered during arrest

description: Sen. Tommy Tuberville, R-Ala., is telling senators that he plans to run for governor of Alabama, according to two sources with knowledge of the situation.
title: Sen. Tommy Tuberville is telling senators he plans to run for governor of Alabama

description: A member of the K-pop boy band Just B publicly came out as gay during a concert this week in Los Angeles.
title: Korean boy band member becomes first active K-pop star to come out as gay

description: The first day of the 2025 NFL draft began as expected, with Miami quarterback Cam Ward selected first by Tennessee.
title: NFL draft: Biggest winners, losers of the first round

description: The 2025 NFL Draft kicked off Thursday night in Green Bay, Wisconsin, as the league's future stars were announced in the first round. Miami’s superstar Quarterback Cam Ward became the new face of the Tennessee Titans with the first overall selection. NBC’s Kaylee Hartung reports for TODAY.
title: NFL Draft 2025: See the highlights, fashion, memorable moments

description: Companies warn stores could see far less stocked shelves unless Trump changes his tune on tariffs. A woman worries that potential cuts to Medicaid would threaten life-saving treatments for her son. And a polarizing NFL prospect remains on the board for the draft.
title: Higher tariffs could keep a stockpile of unused products and fears over Medicaid funding: Morning Rundown

description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker is backing Lt. Gov. Juliana Stratton in what's expected to be a crowded field to succeed Sen. Dick Durbin.
title: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker to endorse for Senate, lending his political muscle – and likely some resources

description: Diana and Rick Bellamy initially planned to take a Caribbean cruise out of Houston before heading to Laurel, Mississippi, to visit the home of one of their favorite HGTV shows, “Home Town.”
title: Canadians put off by Trump’s bluster and border arrests are booking far fewer U.S. visits

description: Wildlife is returning to the Eaton Fire burn area and scientists are closely tracking it four months after the area.
title: Left alone by humans, wildlife returns to the Eaton Fire burn area

description: Colorado Buffaloes quarterback Shedeur Sanders was not selected in the first round of the NFL draft Thursday.
title: Shedeur Sanders not selected in first round of NFL draft

description: Florida state Senate Minority Leader Jason Pizzo announced Thursday that he is leaving the Democratic Party.
title: Top Democrat in the Florida state Senate says his party is 'dead' and registers as independent

description: A private equity executive is accused of raping and assaulting six women in his New York City apartment over a five-month period, and prosecutors say "there may be more survivors" of the man's alleged wrath.
title: Private equity executive charged with beating, raping women in his New York City apartment

description: An Idaho judge refused to rule out the death penalty in the trial of Bryan Kohberger, who is accused of fatally stabbing four University of Idaho students in 2022. Kohberger’s attorneys had sought to strike capital punishment as an option in his upcoming trial due to his autism diagnosis. NBC News’ Camila Bernal reports.
title: Judge allows death penalty in case against Bryan Kohberger

description: The 2025 NFL draft was only minutes old when one of the league’s newest general managers shook up the night with a blockbuster trade.
title: Jacksonville Jaguars shake up NFL draft by trading up to take Travis Hunter with second pick

description: As Saigon fell, Vietnamese families fled. 50 years later, they sit down with their American-born children to share stories of what happened then, and since.
title: From Vietnam: Refugee parents recount their family history
